getValue

Class RoomValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • getValue.RoomValue

  • public class RoomValue
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to return information on a given room. Given the room name and the location of the database, a string with the requested stat will be returned.
    Author:
    Nicholas Ingalls

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RoomValue(java.lang.String data, java.lang.String room)
      Constructs a new object with a string containing the database location and a string containing the room name.

    • Method Detail

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns the title of the room. Each room has a distinct room name. The room name is the name of the folder that the room is in. Each room also has a Title. The room name is used by the server to distinguish between different rooms while the Title is shown to the user. Multiple rooms can have the same title but not the same Room name.
        Returns:
        A String containing the title of the room

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String strLine)
        Sets a new title of a room
        Parameters:
        strLine - A string that will overwrite room title

      • getDesc

        public java.lang.String getDesc()
        Returns the description of a room. The description is not wrapped and the calling class must wrap it to fit in the terminal window.
        Returns:
        A String containing the description

      • setDesc

        public void setDesc(java.lang.String strLine)
        Sets a new description
        Parameters:
        strLine - A string that will overwrite the room description.
